intro: Schizanthus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf love flower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are borne in clusters and have a unique, spurred shape that distinguishes it from other members of the Solanaceae family. Schizanthus angustifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
